TopicTitle: Are contract timelimits in kerbin days or normal days?

Articles.Content:
just a question about time and how it relates to .24 and contracts.

unrelated: i think its dumb that a kerbin day isnt going to be an even 6 hours now. at least thats what i read in another thread
Good question, since I (and many others) don't use Kerbin time.
I would not be surprised if the contracts are given in seconds in their configuration, and then converted in-place in the contract display view based on the setting you chose for timekeeping.

just a question about time and how it relates to .24 and contracts.

unrelated: i think its dumb that a kerbin day isnt going to be an even 6 hours now. at least thats what i read in another thread

I don't know, but I assume that it will be like everything else in the game and will report time in that screen based on what you prefer to see.

And your unrelated concern isn't a concern. A Kerbal Day is still 6 hours long. If something is going to happen in exactly 3 days, it's still going to happen in exactly 18 hours. Kerbin just spins a little faster (or slower. I always get the details wrong when I try to figure this stuff out) so the Sun rises at the exact same time of day all year. That doesn't happen right now. You never noticed it because it really doesn't matter, and you won't notice this change because it (still) doesn't really matter.
